title: Traditional Moussaka
summary: Layers of eggplant, spiced meat sauce, and creamy bechamel, baked to perfection.

items: 3 large eggplants, sliced into 1/2 inch rounds
1 cup grated kefalotyri or parmesan cheese

instructions.value: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and arrange on baking sheets. Sprinkle with salt and bake for 20 minutes until golden. Set aside.
In a large pan, brown the ground meat over medium-high heat. Add onions and garlic, cook until softened.
Add tomatoes, tomato paste, wine, cinnamon, nutmeg, and bay leaves. Simmer for 30 minutes until sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper.
For the bechamel, melt butter in a saucepan. Whisk in flour and cook for 2 minutes. Gradually add warm milk, whisking constantly until smooth and thick.
Remove from heat. Whisk egg yolks in a bowl, then slowly add some hot bechamel to temper. Pour egg mixture back into the sauce, add cheese and nutmeg. Stir well.
In a 9x13 inch baking dish, layer half the eggplant, then all the meat sauce, then remaining eggplant. Pour bechamel over the top, spreading evenly.
Bake for 45 minutes until golden brown and bubbling. Let rest for 15 minutes before cutting and serving.

tips_and_notes: Salting the eggplant before baking helps remove bitterness and excess moisture
Make the meat sauce a day ahead for deeper flavors
Let the moussaka rest after baking so it sets properly and is easier to slice
